alert.note: Alert for Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains including Mount Graham; Santa Catalina and Rincon Mountains including Mount Lemmon, Summerhaven; White Mountains of Graham and Greenlee Counties including Hannagan Meadow (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 3:16AM MST until December 23 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow is expected above 8000 feet. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches are expected above 8000 feet in the Pinaleno and White Mountains, with 4 to 8 inches expected above 8000 feet on the Catalina and Rincon Mountains. * WHERE...White Mountains in northern Graham and northern Greenlee Counties, Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains in Graham county, and Catalina and Rincon Mountains in eastern Pima county. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult, especially Friday night into Saturday morning which is expected to be the time period with the most accumulation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A wet Pacific storm system moving through the region will keep snow levels elevated above 9000 feet early this evening, then lowering to near 6,500 feet Saturday morning. Given the wet nature of this system, confidence is low on the presence of impactful heavy snowfall below 8000 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
